definition: to provoke/to irritate/to vex/to stir up/to anger/to attract (troubles)/to cause (problems)
to inject/to pour into/to concentrate/to pay attention/stake (gambling)/classifier for sums of money/variant of 註|注[zhu4]
Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]

sentences.english: We stood out a mile on that first day at school.
sentences.chinese: 上學第一天，我們就非常惹人注意。

sentences.english: The kid likes to act up for the benefit of anyone who cares to notice.
sentences.chinese: 這孩子喜歡做各種動作來惹人注意。

sentences.english: Stop grandstanding, Sally. Everyone can see you.
sentences.chinese: 別再惹人注意了，薩莉，大家都能看見你。

sentences.english: Fifth Elder Ma sits by himself in an inconspicuous corner drinking tea.
sentences.chinese: 馬五爺在不惹人注意的角落，獨自坐着喝茶。

sentences.english: I did not want to look conspicuous.
sentences.chinese: 我不想讓自己的樣子惹人注意。
他討厭那些惹人注意的政治家們。
她很漂亮，真的很惹人注意。

sentences.english: Jean Valjean had left the garden uncultivated, in order not to attract attention.
sentences.chinese: 冉阿讓也不修整那園子，免得惹人注意。

sentences.english: but I don't want to be too rich.  Rich people are always watched by others.
sentences.chinese: 但是我不要變得很有錢，有錢人老是惹人注意。

definition: to act ostentatiously/to brag/to show off
attention/to stare at/to fix attention on sth
to provoke (esp. annoyance, disgust etc)/to offend/to attract (attention)
to parade oneself ostentatiously about town (idiom)
to be an irksome presence (i.e. sth or sb one wishes were not there)
to drill or bore a hole/to attract attention/conspicuous
to contrast/to set off one another/to go well with
